title: Best Practices for Implementing Predictive Maintenance in Manufacturing
content:
I'm looking to implement a predictive maintenance program in our manufacturing facility. We have various CNC machines and assembly lines. What are the key considerations and best practices we should follow? Specifically interested in:

1. Essential sensors and data points to monitor
2. Integration with existing CMMS
3. Staff training requirements
4. Common pitfalls to avoid

replies.content:
From our experience implementing predictive maintenance, here are the key points:

1. Start with critical equipment first - don't try to monitor everything at once
2. Essential sensors: vibration, temperature, and power consumption monitors
3. Ensure your CMMS can handle real-time data integration
4. Train maintenance staff on both data interpretation and new maintenance procedures

Adding to Sarah's points, don't forget about:

1. Data quality validation
2. Regular sensor calibration
3. Creating baseline measurements
4. Setting up proper alert thresholds
